item.title: Michelle add a quote by Michelle Sutton
item.description: "No wonder being a real Christian isn't popular. Who wants to suffer so they can find joy?" -- Michelle Sutton

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Michelle Sutton
item.description: "Well if God wanted a broken spirit out of me, He would get His wish. At this point in my life the only thing I could do was look up." -- Michelle Sutton

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Faith is taking the first step even when you can't see the whole staircase." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Eric Wilson
item.description: "As fallible humans, we usually slip too far over one edge or the other - all wrath and judgment or all grace and love." -- Eric Wilson

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Michelle add a quote by James L. Rubart
item.description: "Utterly engulfed, And wanting more. Buried, Drowned, Intoxicated, With the vastness of love. Losing myself as the waves wash over me, Through me, Surrounding me, Caught up in the a hurricane of overwhelming peace, I have let go, And He has found me." -- James L. Rubart

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Katherine Anne Porter
item.description: "The past is never where you think you left it." -- Katherine Anne Porter

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Michelle Sutton
item.description: "With a lump forming in his throat, he thought about all the hopes and dreams that he had for his son. More than anything, he prayed his boy would not grow up to be a screw up like his dad when it came to love and marriage." -- Michelle Sutton

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Michelle Sutton
item.description: "Life was good. Everything was going right. It was almost scaring him because usually when things were going this well it was the calm before the storm hit." -- Michelle Sutton

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Michelle Sutton
item.description: "Is no problem." -- Michelle Sutton

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Michelle Sutton
item.description: "You’re playing with a blow torch, and it’s pointed at your head. Think about what you’re saying." -- Michelle Sutton

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Michelle Sutton
item.description: "Who knew better than Raquel that nothing lasts. Hope fades. And love... love hurts." -- Michelle Sutton

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Michelle Sutton
item.description: "I get what you're saying, but my hanging with the ladies is mostly for publicity when I'm on tour. I don't sleep with that many girls. Well, not all of them. Okay, I'm trying to behave myself. It's not easy being famous!" -- Michelle Sutton

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Debra Ullrick
item.description: "Real love ain't no fantasy - it's messy, and sometimes it's downright hard. And with real love there's no guarantee you'll never get hurt. You can't love somebody with one foot out of the door. If you love her, its got to be all the way, no matter what happens. That's real love - not this straddling the fence thing you've got going on." -- Debra Ullrick

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Laura Frantz
item.description: "She could no longer remember what Ambrose looked like, or smelled like, or was like. All she knew was Cassius Clayton McLinn. All she wanted began and ended with him." -- Laura Frantz

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Laura Frantz
item.description:
"His tender tone turned her heart over. She obliged, tilting her head back slightly and looking up at him in the firelit darkness. When he bent his head and his mouth met hers, she gave a little sigh, her lips parting slightly in surprise and expectation. He kissed her with the same sure decisiveness with which he did everything else, his mouth trailing to her cheek and chin and ear, returning again and again to her mouth and lingering there, his breath mingling with her own.
She felt adrift in small, sharp bursts of pleasure. Was this how a man was suppose to kiss a woman? Tenderly... firmly... repeatedly? His fingers fanned through her hair till the pins gave way and wayward locks spilled like black ribbon to the small of her back. In answer, her arms circled his neck, bringing him nearer, every kiss sweeter and surer than the one before. Soon they were lost in a haze of sighs and murmurs and caresses." -- Laura Frantz

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Tosca Lee
item.description: "And I know that God made the heart the most fragile and resilient of all organs, that a lifetime of joy and pain might be encased in one mortal chamber." -- Tosca Lee

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Noah Webster
item.description: "The heart should be cultivated with more assiduity than the head." -- Noah Webster

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Melanie Dickerson
item.description: "Perhaps time is an inconsistent healer, but God can purge even the most painful memories." -- Melanie Dickerson

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired, and success achieved." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "I can shake off everything as I write; my sorrows disappear, my courage is reborn." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Chris Fabry
item.description: "You may forsake a person, a family, some location of the heart, but scars and memories cannot be discarded like used clothing." -- Chris Fabry

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Michelle Sutton
item.description: "No wonder being a real Christian isn't popular. Who wants to suffer so they can find joy?" ~ Dianne Simmons" -- Michelle Sutton

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Paul Simon
item.description: "It's actually very difficult to make something both simple and good." -- Paul Simon

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Anne Tyler
item.description: "I read so I can live more than one life in more than one place." -- Anne Tyler
